result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Allan Waara

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

4:15 PM Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark Allan Waara in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Mark Allan Waara. Court questions where matters is at.  Atty Reetz indicates have not reached resolution yet, requests another status.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Status conference on July 18, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

4:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark Allan Waara in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Mark Allan Waara. Defense waives formal reading of criminal complaint, enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
Cash bond posted by Mark Waara.

No violent contact direct or indirect with K.N. Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.

1:08 PM Defendant Mark Allan Waara in court.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.  Court questions Defendant on address/employment history. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
